data.title: Cannot watch for file changes for files on disk root
data.body:
Code version: 0.10.6
OS: Windows 10 x64

I have noticed that if a file is open in code and the file is changed externally, there is no way to know about it until I try to save it. I feel that if the file on the disk and file opened on code is in same state it should automatically reflect the changes made on the disk. This is what every modern text  editor do.
Here is how to reproduce it.
- Create a text file.
- Open the file in Sublime text, Bracket and Code. In this situation the file is blank in all 3 editors.
- In Sublime text, write "Hello". Then save.
- Switch to Bracket, You will see "Hello".
- Switch to Code, you will see blank.
- Now again switch to Bracket, write "Hello world". Then save.
- Switch to Sublime text, You will see "Hello world".
- Switch to Code, you will see blank.

In both cases Code should reflect the changes made on disk.

data.title: [php] Newline characters not escaped correctly

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
In many languages you can write a multi-line string by escaping the newline character, e.g.:

```
myString = "this \
is a multiline \
string";
```

However, in vscode, the text highlighting is broken when you have multi-line strings (the colour assigned to the string is only applied to the part of the string before the first back-slash, and as a result the text highlighting of the remaining part of the file is broken too).
I was able to reproduce the issue in PHP files, other languages might be affected too.

data.title: 'dnu restore' EACCES on Mac OS X.
data.body:
Version 0.10.6 (0.10.6)
-    1.0.0-rc1-update1    coreclr x64          darwin          default

I ran `>dnx: Restore Packages` and received a `EACCES` from **npm**.

```
npm ERR! Darwin 14.5.0
npm ERR! argv "node" "/usr/local/bin/npm" "install"
npm ERR! node v0.10.35
npm ERR! npm  v2.3.0
npm ERR! path /Users/bparrish/.npm/lru-cache/2.7.3
npm ERR! code EACCES
npm ERR! errno 3

npm ERR! Error: EACCES, mkdir '/Users/bparrish/.npm/lru-cache/2.7.3'
npm ERR!  { [Error: EACCES, mkdir '/Users/bparrish/.npm/lru-cache/2.7.3']
npm ERR!   errno: 3,
npm ERR!   code: 'EACCES',
npm ERR!   path: '/Users/bparrish/.npm/lru-cache/2.7.3',
npm ERR!   parent: 'minimatch' }
npm ERR! 
npm ERR! Please try running this command again as root/Administrator.

npm ERR! Please include the following file with any support request:
npm ERR!     /Users/bparrish/Visual Studio Code/WebApplication/npm-debug.log
The 'postrestore' script failed with status code 3.

Errors in postrestore
    The 'postrestore' script failed with status code 3.
```

I was able to resolve the issue by running the terminal command as `sudo ...` and then rerunning the dnu restore as not sudo to get by the next error with bower.

data.title: Provide access to current editor column
data.body:
I want to open a document right side of current editor according to the following logic:

If current editor is on column 1, side editor must be on column 2,
If current editor is on column 2, side editor must be on column 3,
if current editor is on column 3, side editor must be on column 1.

Also, if the target document to open is already opened in any of the existing editors, then no new editor shall be opened but the editor with the target document opened shall get the focus.

window has the showTextDocument with an argument to indicate the column. This can be used when the new document is still not opened, but if the target document is already opened, you have no way to know in which column.

I've tried a loop over all editors and that doesn't work because the order of the editors array does not follow the same order as the column numbers.

I've found no satisfactory solution for this problem and having access to every editor column might help a lot.

data.title: Use StringMatch for finding files
data.body:
VSCode's "Go To File" function isn't very lenient. You can type the path to a file, but you have to include the full folder names and slashes. E.g.: `app/webroot/main.css`, or `webroot/main.css`.

[Brackets](http://brackets.io), another code editor, has much more lenient matching. You could find that file by typing `appwebmain`, or even just `apwemain` or `awm`. Any sequence of characters that appear in the file's path will work. Something short like `awm` could match multiple files, but it's good at determining which one you meant (based on special characters and capitalization in the path and filename).

You can read about the algorithm [here](http://blog.brackets.io/2013/04/03/brackets-quick-open-thats-no-regex/). The file that does the work is [StringMatch.js](https://github.com/adobe/brackets/blob/2c1616a6346dfee29a8321b5ecc9e0f636ec42d8/src/utils/StringMatch.js). According to the copyright notice, it'd be OK to use that in VSCode.

I know that some work is being done on the Go To File function in issue #55. Using StringMatch would be a related improvement.

data.title: Add some API to support GUI customization
data.body:
VS Code is a great coding IDE, but developers love to customize their tools to make them feel like home and VS Code lacks those customization abilities. 

I love the sublime material theme and I wanted to implement it in VS Code but as far as I can see it's not possible now because only the coding area is customizable. So in my opinion some improvement in ui customization would be welcomed by a lot of us. In the ideal word every pixel and element of VS Code should be customizable with extensions, but for start it would be enough to start with the following things:
- customization of the side panel (#427 and #123)
- adding support for custom tabs, the possibilities of the quick box is very limited (#710)
- adding the ability to add and remove ui elements (e.g. a bottom panel for error listing like in Atom)

I have read about the [approach](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/extensions/our-approach) followed by VS Code. So instead of allowing extensions to create custom ui elements, VS Code itself should provide some API for this, what allows to the developers to set the content, but the styling of the content should be based on the theme of VS Code.

So in a nutshell: VS Code core provide the bones and template of the ui elements, extension developers can set the content but not the style and theme developers can style the content.

data.title: Debug hover complex inspection
data.body:
- [x] win @dbaeumer 
- [x] mac @bpasero
- [x] linux @aeschli 

We have improved the **debug hover** when inspecting complex variables. Verify:
- Hovering over simple variables shows hover as before
- Simple variable hover **wraps** long values
- Hovering over a complex variables shows a **tree** inside the hover
  - You can use the tree to **fully inspect** the complex variable
  - Tree **compactly** shows the data
  - Complex hover grows / shrinks with the tree
  - Complex hover **disappears** not too early not too late

data.title: register text document provider
data.body: PR to implement  #272

data.title: Conditional breakpoints
data.body:
- [x] win @dbaeumer 
- [x] mac @bpasero
- [x] linux @aeschli 

We now support **conditional breakpoints** for node. Verify:
- You can **add** a new conditional breakpoint
- You can **edit** a condition of any breakpoint
- Conditional breakpoints are hit **only if the condition is true**
- Conditional breakpoints are **persisted** between vscode restarts

Suggestions and feedback on the conditional breakpoint **UI** is very welcome.

data.body:

[https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/How-to-Contribute#build-and-run-from-source](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/How-to-Contribute#build-and-run-from-source). 
I just wanted to build VS Code from scratch on an Ubuntu box (14.04). After having executed the recommended command

trying to execute

However: The hidden directory .vscode has been created. It seems to be a tiny typo. So I would like to ask the team to look into this.
Thanks.

data.title: call ConfigurationDoneRequest from debug frontend
data.body: VSCode debug frontend needs to call a `ConfigurationDoneRequest` at the end of processing the debug adapter's Initialized event (that is after calling the SetBreakpointsRequest and SetExceptionsBreakpointsRequest).

data.title: January Iteration Plan
data.body:
We are back from the holidays and are rolling again. We are starting to target our next important milestone for Code, the [Build 2016 conference](http://build.microsoft.com/), which takes place at end of March in San Francisco. The [roadmap](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Roadmap) outlines our high level plans for getting there and this is our detailed plan for the January 2016 iteration. 

We plan to declare General Availability ("GA") with the March 2016 release. GA comes with several quality obligations in areas such as accessibility and localization. We know that we have significant gaps here and we want to start to tackle them right away. On the drive to Connect(); we accumulated engineering debt that we must to address sooner rather than later. And, as we always do, we will continue to ship monthly and address key development pain points and adoption blockers.  

Based on these imperatives we arrived at the following themes for January:
- Ramp up the work to get to GA (accessibility, localization, ...).
- Reduce the engineering debt.
- Respond to feedback and try to address as many issues as possible.

The [January Test Plan](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aopen+label%3Atestplan-item+milestone%3A%22Jan+2016%22) is in progress.
### Schedule

The goal is to make the January update available by the following dates.

End game dates (we end an iteration with an [endgame](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Development-Process#end-game))
- Monday Jan 25th evening (GMT+1): freeze
- Tuesday: test day
- Wednesday: fix day
- Thursday: fix day
- Friday: Done: documentation, release notes update, bugs verified

:warning: update we will switch to `dev channels` and deprecate the `insider channel`. We will make the new dev channels available as soon as possible during the end game and will hold back updating the stable channel until we have received early feedback.
### Plan Items

:runner: = work in progress
:hand: = task is blocked
:muscle: = stretch goal for this iteration

**Feedback**
Issues to address feedback from the community:
- [x] UI: Improve auto save behaviour, support to customize auto save delay, support to save on focus lost @bpasero 
  - Issues #353, #1055, #1211 
  - Test #1854 
  - [x] Release notes
- [x] UI: Support to hide the menu bar @bpasero 
  - Issues #945, #1563 
  - Test #2226 
  - [x] Release notes
- [x] UI: Intellisense - no way to show full documentation for a completion proposal @joaomoreno 
  - Test #2230 
  - [x] Release notes
- [x] Editor: Support ligatures #192 @alexandrudima
  - [x] Release notes @jrieken
- [x] UI: More colorful default `Dark` and `Lite` themes @aeschli
  - Issue #1470, #1849
  - Test #2256
  - [x] Release notes
- [x] UI: Find widget improvements #1999 #2033 #2010 #1869
  - Test #1869
  - [x] Release notes
- [x] UI: new welcome page experience #2166 @sofianHn
  - Test #2251  
- Debug: Generalize debug adapter protocol to support other debuggers like XDebug @weinand 
  - [x] Microsoft/vscode-debugadapter-node#4
  - [x] Microsoft/vscode-debugadapter-node#9
  - [x]  Microsoft/vscode-debugadapter-node#5
  - Test #2183 
  - [x] Release notes
- [x] Debug; Indicate changed values in Variables pane
  - Issue #866 
  - Test #2171 
  - [x] Release notes
- [x] Debug; Support conditional break points @isidorn, @weinand
  - Issue #1582, Microsoft/vscode-debugadapter-node#6
  - Test #1830
  - [x] Release notes
- Debug: support to remote debug node running inside a docker container
  - [x] improve source path matching (#1591) @weinand
  - [x] support "address" attribute on "attach" launch config (Microsoft/vscode-node-debug#32) @weinand
  - Test #2188
  - [x] Release notes
- [x] API: Support to create a TextDocument virtually @jrieken 
  - Issue #272
  - Test #2007
  - [x] Release notes
- [x] API: Richer quick pick support @jrieken
  - Issue: #1795
  - Test #2008
  - [x] Release notes
- [x] API: command to preview html document (#1308) @jrieken
  - Test #2099 
  - [x] Release notes
- [x] API: Allow to map a filename to a language based on a prefix (#1851) @jrieken 
  - Test #2238
  - [x] Release notes
- [x] API: Provide API to current editor column #1835 
  - Test #2152
  - [x] Release notes
- [x] API: Support Markdown in the API (MarkedString)
  - Test #2222 
  - [x] Release notes
- [x] _IntelliSense filtering has become slow again in huge lists_ #1923 @joaomoreno
  - Test #2254
  - [x] Release notes

**Debt Items**
This section lists items to reduce our engineering debt:
- Start to migrate 'built-in' language services into extensions 
  - [x] Migrate JSON into an extension @aeschli 
  - Test #2257 
  - [x] Release notes
  - _Deferred_ - Provide JSON language service in standalone monaco editor @aeschli @alexandrudima
- _Deferred_ -  Intellisense for asp.net 5 package dependencies in the `project.json` is currently hard coded into JSON language, Enable that this can be contributed by the C# extension.  
- [x] Debug: Provide a test suite for debugger adapters @weinand
  - [x] Release notes
- [x] Extensions: Separate the vscode related tools from the vscode API into the existing vscode module #970 @bpasero 
  - Currently the vscode node module combines the tools and the vscode API into one unit, we want to decouple the API from the used modules.
  - Test #1881
  - [x] Release notes

**Adoptions**
We continuously have to adopt components which we require:
- [x] Adopt electron 0.35.6  @bpasero 
  - Issues: #1485 
  - [x] Release notes
- _Deferred - TS 1.8 isn't available yet_ Adopt [TypeScript 1.8](https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/wiki/Roadmap)
  - 1.8Beta is planned for Jan 25th #836  @dbaeumer
  - Update the vscode-extension yo generator to depend on 1.8 @bpasero 
- _not for January release_ Adopt the a newer version of OmniSharp @jrieken

**Engineering Items**
This section lists several engineering/development items that the team identified:
- [x] JS: [Salsa](Microsoft/TypeScript#4789) support for JS and provide feedback @jrieken @egamma @dbaeumer
  - Test #2218 
  - [x] Release Notes
- [x] UI: Support that the debug output and task output is shown in a horizontal bar #1875 @isidorn
  - Tests #2176, #2173
  - [x] Release Notes
- [x] Debug: Improve the value hover for rich objects by using the tree widget @isidorn
  - Test #1832
  - [x] Release Notes
- [x] Debug: support source maps with inlined source
  - Issues: #1793, Microsoft/vscode-node-debug#27
  - Test #2183
  - [x] Release Notes
- :hand: Build: Automated Mac build signing @joaomoreno 
- [x] Install: Support side-by-side installs of VS Code from different channels (insider, stable) @joaomoreno, @bpasero
  - Test done by selfhost
- [x] Enable tslint for vscode #2102 @egamma
  - Test - covered by dog fooding

**Initial Investigations**
- :runner: Keyboard accessibility  #2108 @bpasero 
  - Test #2145
  - [x] Release Notes
- :runner: Screen reading support in the editors @alexandrudima 
  - Test #2258
  - [x] Release Notes
- :runner: Localization: investigate into localizing Code  #2041 @dbaeumer
  - Test #2228
  - [x] Release Notes
## Bugs

This section includes bug queries for the vscode related repositories:
- [vscode](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3Abug+-label%3Aupstream+milestone%3A%22Jan+2016%22)

For more information about our development process please refer to the development process [page](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Development-Process).

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

The define keybinding helper is great, but it would be nice If it could allow a second keybinding to be added it it detects ctrl+k have been entered. Like the ctrl+k ctrl+k that is needed to open the helper in the first place.
Thanks

data.title: Add autocomplete for keybindings.json

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
It would be useful to have auto complete for the `command`and `when` fields in the keybindings.json.
I don't think this would be too hard for when as as far as I understand extensions cannot add new events. However commands may be slightly trickier as you would have to incorporate commands from extensions, but these are registered anyway so hopefully would not be a show stopper.
Thanks

data.title: Add a keyboard shortcut for staging the current file

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
It would be great if there was a keyboard shortcut, or at least an unassigned command, to stage the current file (ie git add) so that the entire process could be done with the keyboard. 
Also navigation of the git add and git revert icons in the git sidebar by keyboard would also be nice (I don't think this can even be done in accessibility mode).

data.title: Putting a breakpoint in an internal module does not work
data.body:
Start debugging, open an internal module (e.g module.js) and try to set a breakpoint in the internal module -> breakpoint validation removes breakpoint.

Debugging this showed that both arrays 'breakpoints' and 'lines' are empty.

data.title: The execution process is not correct of Python

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
when I excute the code like this:
import threading
import asyncio

@asyncio.coroutine
def hello():
    print("hello world (%s)" % threading.currentThread())
    yield from asyncio.sleep(5)
    print("hello again (%s)" % threading.currentThread())

loop = asyncio.get_event_loop()
tasks = [hello(),hello()]
loop.run_until_complete(asyncio.wait(tasks))
loop.close()

the correct process is display the hello world,and pause 5 second ,and display the hello again.
but when I do the excution is vscode .. it pauses for 5 second ,and display the all result.

ISSUE：the output that in vscode is not the same as in python console of a Same piece of code.
